channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NE
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NE

item.title: Report X-2023030167
item.description:
Report X-2023030167

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-04T00:49:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-20
  • City: LINCOLN
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Admin was unloading trailer and found package already wet. Thought it was leaked on from another package, but no other packages around it were wet. Put it in a red hazmat tote and took it to QA for further inspection. DescribePack: Inner drum does have some dents and scratches on it around the top rim. It must've leaked under the metal lid. Can't see crack. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a red hazmat tote with orientation arrows facing up to prevent release

item.title: Report E-2023020289
item.description:
Report E-2023020289

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-04T00:49:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-06
  • City: AURORA
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal XGN experienced a UN3082 "Hero Insecticide" release from a 250-gallon poly tote due to improper loading. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 40-gallons of product released to the asphalt parking lot in two areas measuring 130' x 12' and 200' x 1' and to the trailer floor in a 4' x 12' area. Crew confirmed the tote was punctured by the trailer wall. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into (6) 55-gallon closed top poly drums. Oil Dri was deployed to the impacted areas and worked in. Once all material was collected, all waste including the damaged cut up tote were collected and containerized into (13) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one metal 55 gallon drum of IPA (un1219) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 gallon of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LOGISTICS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering gasoline into the customer's storage tank. It appears that a venting issue caused the storage tank to overpressurize. This caused approximately 10 gallons of gasoline to be released. Environmental Restoration responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

  • Description: UNLOADER COULD SMELL SOME PAINT COMING FROM A BOX IN THE TRAILER. FOUND THE BOX PRETTY QUICKLY AND CALLED THE RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER CAME AND FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND THE RESPONSE SHEET TO CLEAN UP AND CONTAIN THE SPILL. RESPONDER PROCESSED THROUGH DAMAGE MATERIALS PROGRAM.

item.title: Report X-2022120955
item.description:
Report X-2022120955

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T21:25:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-16
  • City: NORFOLK
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was suspected to have leaked during unload due to a strong vinegar smell coming from it and was immediately secured in a HazMat tote. No liquid ever made it to the outer packaging of the box, it was all absorbed by the inner packaging. DescribePack: Cap of one of the inner 5 liter bottles was slightly loose allowing a small amount of liquid to leak out at some point, likely during unload. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was secured in HazMat tote. No liquid ever left the inner package.

item.title: Report E-2022120026
item.description:
Report E-2022120026

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T21:25:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-29
  • City: SHELTON
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR GLOBAL LOGISTICS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 29, 2022, at 0830 ET, approximately 1385 gallons of Blitz 22 was released due to a single vehicle accident that occurred when the truck struck a deer resulted in a vehicle roll over. Haz-Mat Response were dispatched by ERTS to manage and oversee environmental operations. Upon arrival Haz-Mat Response personnel observed smoke and fumes that were blowing across the interstate to the south. Haz-Mat Response personnel donned PPE and began to transfer the remaining contents from the totes into new totes that had been delivered while the fire department hose down the totes. The transferred product was placed into 2-275 gallon totes, 9-225 gallon totes, and 1-300 gallon tote. One additional tote was generated with the rinse water. The broken totes were broken down and placed into one (1) roll-off box along with the debris from the trailer. The new totes were transported to the DOT yard in Shelton, NE along with the roll-off box to be staged for disposal. The median was secured by Haz-Mat Response personnel for future remediation.

item.title: Report X-2022110075
item.description:
Report X-2022110075

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T21:25:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-27
  • City: OMAHA
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED DRY ICE COOLING PIZZA. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX INDICATING DRY ICE WAS BEING USED. THERE IS A PARTIALLY VISIBLE KEEP FROZEN LABEL. THE BOX IS A THERMOSAFE INSULATED SHIPPER IMPRINTED AS TEMPERTURE SENSITIVE PRODUCT. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 115Y4V, DI MANUFACTURING, 13335 C ST, OMAHA NE 68144.

  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE DUE TO THE PRODUCT LABEL INFORMATION ON THE OUTER BOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (1) ONE GALLON JUG OF FLAMMABLE CHEM MAX SUBLIME SOLVENT BOOSTER. OUTER BOX WAS MARKED FRAGILE AND HAD THE PRODUCT INFORMATION LABEL AFFIXED TO THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE ALSO CONTAINED NON REGULATED CHEM MAX DYE RELEASE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 5E9846, BRITE N KLEEN, 10345 CHANDLER CIRCLE, LA VISTA NE 68128.

item.title: Report X-2022090796
item.description:
Report X-2022090796

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T21:25:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-30
  • City: LINCOLN
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PH discovered hazmat package was wet and notified manager. they put the package in a plastic tote and placed it by the QA cage for inspection. DescribePack: small cut on the bottom of plastic bag closure. the leak size is very small. a small bead of liquid slowly leaks out every couple seconds. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was put directly into a plastic tote and flipped upside down to stop leak. leak was discovered by QA to be on bottom of inner plastic bag, so it was removed and is placed in tote so it won't leak.

item.title: Report X-2022080829
item.description:
Report X-2022080829

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T21:25:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-21
  • City: NORTH PLATTE
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Union Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: GBTX 1029 was found with a small drip coming from the bottom outlet and blind flange. Upon investigation it was found that the valve was not locked in position and the blind flange was not tightened sufficiently. Valve was locked into the closed position and flange tightened to tool tight.

UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED A LASER LEVEL WITH A LITHIUM ION BATTERY PACKED WITH THE EQUIPMENT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER CASE. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER A75R46, PAK MAIL US327, 1704 N BELL ST., FREMONT NE 68025.

  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver stated that once customer air was connected, the hose began to vibrate and the cam-lock on the customer side popped off spilling about 25 gallons of Sodium Hydroxide Solution into the Customers containment area. No velcro strap was used on customers end. Customer cleaned up the spill and told GTI driver that he was released.

item.title: Report X-2022060544
item.description:
Report X-2022060544

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T21:25:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-11
  • City: NORTH PLATTE
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: No More than one gallon of the product was released out og the door at the rear of a Haz-Wast Roll-off box. Upon investigation it was found that the chain securing the door was loose allowing a small amount of product to get by the door seal. The door was secured and all of the product released was recovered and placed into own haz-waste container. The flat car and other areas touch by the product were decontaminated and all rinse aid and contaminated absorbents were recovered and placed in a haz waste bin.

  • Description: On June 10, 2022, nine (9) 5-gallon pails of paint were damaged during transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration, LLC (ER) to perform the necessary corrective action. ER personnel drummed the damaged containers and utilized absorbents to remediate the impacted surface.
